Author: hastrup#8742
Content: hi im having a problem starting qt wallet im in linux ubuntu 18.04

Author: hastrup#8742
Content: when i use: ./komodo-qt-linux -ac_name=BOTS -ac_supply=999999 -addnode=95.213.238.98 $1 & -reindex &

Author: hastrup#8742
Content: it start the chain

Author: hastrup#8742
Content: but when i use: ./komodo-qt-linux

Author: hastrup#8742
Content: it wont start komodo

Author: hastrup#8742
Content:
QXcbConnection: XCB error: 148 (Unknown), sequence: 174, resource id: 0, major code: 140 (Unknown), minor code: 20
~KomodoApplication : Deleted window
~KomodoApplication : Deleted paymentServer
~KomodoApplication : Deleted optionsModel
~KomodoApplication : Deleted platformStyle

Author: hastrup#8742
Content: Error: Cannot parse configuration file: Missing komodo.conf. Only use key=value syntax.

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
`$1` is for use in a script where you sent it an option thing
and there can only be one `&` in a given line
....
`Missing komodo.conf.` means exactly what it says; in order to run for KMD, you must have a properly formatted `komodo.conf` file in `~/.komodo`

Author: hastrup#8742
Content: that is what i have in my folder

Author: hastrup#8742
Content:
pc~/Downloads/komodo-qt-linux $ ./komodo-qt-linux
QXcbConnection: XCB error: 148 (Unknown), sequence: 174, resource id: 0, major code: 140 (Unknown), minor code: 20
~KomodoApplication : Deleted window
~KomodoApplication : Deleted paymentServer
~KomodoApplication : Deleted optionsModel
~KomodoApplication : Deleted platformStyle
pc ~/Downloads/komodo-qt-linux $

Author: hastrup#8742
Content: now i got it

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: the safest way to backup is to export private keys, wallet.dat as a file as in your case could be a different wallet.dat, or it can get corrupted especially under windows, never rely on just the wallet.dat file in the future.

Author: erav3n#9290
Content: @passcombo.com 🏴☠🍋 for calc address balance - use `listunspent` with filter by needed address and just sum the amounts of available utxos.

Author: erav3n#9290
Content: `getaddressbalance` can be used only in case if you have `addressindex` enabled, which is false by default.

Author: erav3n#9290
Content: so, `listunspent` seems exactly what you want.

Author: Decker#3767
Content:
https://github.com/DeckerSU/KomodoOcean/releases/tag/v2.0.15-rc2-g28-7 - new binaries of Komodo-Qt are available. This version is not yet upcoming hardfork compatible, it just includes some pre-hardfork fixes:

- Possible crash fixed in case of receiving some mailformed transaction (kmdnuke fix)
- Latest KMD checkpoints added (this will allow correct determine of initial block download state)
- Added SSE4 optimized SHA256 implementation (by default it's turned off, to enable it you'll need to recompile binaries with `--enable-experimental-asm` configure option enabled)
- Fixed sync from scratch / stuck during sync with error like below:
 ```
    CheckBlockHeader komodo_check_deposit error
    ...
    Error: Failed to connect best block
```

- Other minor fixes and improvements.
